thread.title: Man arrested after cheating way to 2nd in Kenyan marathon
thread.title_full: Man arrested after cheating way to 2nd in Kenyan marathon

author: wtopstaff
title: Man arrested after cheating way to 2nd in Kenyan marathon
text:
Home » News » Sports » Other Sports » Man arrested after cheating… Man arrested after cheating way to 2nd in Kenyan marathon By The Associated Press October 26, 2015 3:45 am 
NAIROBI, Kenya (AP) — Police say a man was arrested and will face fraud charges after being caught cheating his way to second place in Kenya’s biggest marathon. 
Race officials say the man, identified as 28-year-old Julius Njogu, waited among a group of spectators and then joined the field near the finish of the Nairobi International Marathon. He crossed in second place and was in line to win around $7,000 in prize money before being disqualified. 
Looking much more energetic than the other runners, Njogu claimed second in a sprint finish inside the Nyayo National Stadium. Race officials say they then realized he’d only joined the field just outside the stadium. 
In 2013, two athletes were disqualified from the Nairobi marathon after attempting to cheat their way to podium finishes in the women’s race. Topics:
